intro: Anamirta toxifera, commonly known as the poisonwood plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small white or yellowish flowers, followed by bright red berries that contain toxic seeds. Its roots and leaves contain various alkaloids, which have been used in traditional medicine but are highly toxic in large quantities. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
